source_sentence: 屈二頭指各加於二中指上節上真言曰。
translation: Bending his two forefingers, he places them each on the top knuckle of his two middle fingers and says.

source_sentence: 曩莫三滿多沒馱南阿鉢囉(二合)底賀多舍娑那南唵阿鉢囉(二合)爾多特(他翼反)普通諸佛頂印二手虛心金剛合掌。
translation: "In the second hand, he joins his palms with the open-minded vajra like a flower in his hand.
It's like a flower in the palm of your hand.

source_sentence: 修行者若急遽不能遍結諸佛頂印。
translation: If a practitioner is in a hurry, he can't completely make the buddha-dhāraṇī mudrā.

source_sentence: 但結此印誦諸佛頂真言。
translation: He simply makes this sign and recites the true words of the buddha attendants.
Next, he forms the top sign.
He follows the preceding fundamental mudrā.
He bends his right head finger and raises it behind his right middle finger.
He places it behind his right middle finger.
He causes it to stop touching each other, saying.

source_sentence: 曩莫三滿多沒馱南阿鉢囉(三合)底賀多舍娑那南唵斫羯羅(二合)靺[口*栗](二合)底唵吽次結頭印。
translation: "Anamo samantabhadra-buddhânâbhara(triad) ti hetasahāsana-nam oṃcakra(triad) mo[mou*li](triad) ti om un." He then makes the head sign.
He follows the previous fundamental mudrā.

source_sentence: 開二頭指各直竪於中指後。
translation: Open each of the two forehead fingers and place them directly behind the middle finger.

source_sentence: 令不相著微屈真言曰(歸命同上)。
translation: So that they don't stick together and slightly bend the true saying is (to the same fate as above).

source_sentence: 唵斫羯囉(二合)靺[口*栗](二合)底吽發娑嚩(二合引)訶(引)次又結根本印。
translation: "Om cakra [bla] mo [ku*li] (bla) ti un fa sah (bla) ha (citation needed).
Next, he forms the great samaya mudrā.
He puts his hands together with the hands of the original protector and salutes him with his palms together.
He raises his two middle fingers.
He flexes his two middle fingers and bends them behind his middle finger.
They are separated from each other like hooks by a distance of about 1.5 barley.
Attach each of his two big fingers to the base of his head finger.
Turning them to the right three times, he says, "Om Śaṃkali, moha saṃsāra!

source_sentence: 唵商羯哩摩訶三昧延娑嚩(二合)訶(引)次誦一百八名讚讚歎。
translation: "Om Śaṃkali moha samādhi yan svāhā (binary) ha (citation needed), and then he recites the one hundred and eight names in praise and admiration.
He wants to recite it.
First, he takes the five components of this honored one.
Or he might recite the yoga of the five attributes of the honored one.

source_sentence: 或於三處(頂舌心也)想一字頂輪。
translation: Or, in three places (including the tip of the tongue and the heart), he might contemplate a one-letter top wheel.
This is the eight-leaf lotus on which the Buddha sits.
On each of those leaves, he thinks of the seven treasures.

source_sentence: 唯當前蓮華葉上想佛眼尊。
translation: Only on the first lotus leaf should he contemplate the honored Buddha's eye.

source_sentence: 次應持珠(此依菩提道場所說經)。
translation: Next, he should hold the pearl (this is based on the Sutra Explained at the Place of Enlightenment).
Next, you should hold the pearl with your palms together and hold it in your hand.

source_sentence: 誦淨珠真言七遍真言曰。
translation: He recites the pure gem dhāraṇī seven times, saying.

source_sentence: 唵阿娜步(二合)低尾惹曳(而奚反)悉地悉馱囉梯娑嚩(二合引)訶次結持珠印。
translation: "Om anabuddha, low-tailed jaya, siddhi, siddhârtha, and he then makes the seal for holding the pearl.
With his second hand, he takes his big finger and twists it around his nameless fingernail.
He twists his fingertips above his nameless fingernails.
He straightens his two middle fingers and two little fingers.
He bends his two index fingers behind his middle finger.

source_sentence: 令不相著(如毘盧遮那經半金剛杵印)。
translation: He causes them to stop touching each other (like the half-vajra-mandarins seal in the Vairocana Sutra).
The true teaching says.

source_sentence: 曩謨婆誐嚩底蘇悉第　娑馱耶悉馱囉梯娑嚩(二合引)訶(引)　次應淨其心　　如法而念誦　持珠令當心　　繫心於鼻端　字句分明呼　　不緩亦不急　不頻伸噦嗌　　咳嗽與唾涕　染等心相應　　及心緣苦受　如是等過患　　皆不得成就當念誦時。
translation: "Anāmogha-gaja-vastu-siddhi, satyāyasiddhara, satyāyasiddhara, and satyāhara. Next, purify your mind and recite according to the teaching, holding the beads close to your heart, tying them to the end of your nose, and clearly calling out the words, not being slow or hasty, not stretching out frequently, picking up coughs and spittle, associating with defilements in the mind, and experiencing painful mental conditions. None of these faults will be accomplished when you recite this.
He mustn't become fatigued in body or mind.

source_sentence: 若勞倦即應結五供養印。
translation: If he becomes fatigued, he should then make the five signs of offering.
He recites praises and dedicates his mind to Guhya.
After reciting them, he holds the beads on his head.

source_sentence: 次結前密縫印左轉一匝。
translation: Next, he makes the preceding mudrā sign and turns to his left one turn.
It will then form the boundary of liberation.
Next, he should make the sign of sending off.
He follows the preceding fundamental mudrā.
He throws his left head finger outward.

source_sentence: 誦迎請真言除翳呬翳呬。
translation: He recites the invocation chant, "Greeting," to remove cataracts and frets.
He adds the phrase "tiller, tiller, tiller, tiller.
That's called sending off.

source_sentence: 次應復結牆及網橛等印。
translation: Next, he should again make the sign for walls, nets, and so forth.

source_sentence: 加護處上下及所成就物。
translation: It should guard the place above and below and the object that it accomplishes.
Next, he should make the sign for calculating the amount of time it takes to complete the task.

source_sentence: 以左大指壓左小指甲上。
translation: Take your left big finger and press it against your left little fingernail.
The other three fingers are split apart.
They are held straight up like a three-pronged pounder.

source_sentence: 右旋轉三匝成結界真言曰。
translation: Turning it three times to the right, he forms the true mantra for the barrier, saying.

source_sentence: 唵枳里枳里嚩日囉(二合)吽發
translation: "Om kiṃri kiṃri vajra (bla) unfa.
Next, he makes the military tsharī seal.
He interlaces his two pinkies in his palm.
He takes his two ring fingers and places them on top of his pinky finger.

source_sentence: 以二大指壓二無名指上。
translation: With his two big fingers, he presses his two ring fingers together.
He raises his two middle fingers and presses them together.

source_sentence: 屈二頭指於中指後令一麥許不相著。
translation: Bend the two index fingers behind the middle finger so that they are a wheat thumb away from each other.

source_sentence: 右旋三匝即成結界真言曰。
translation: Turning it three times to the right, he forms the true verbal expression for the boundary, which is.
